Key Match Events: The Indiana Pacers won against the Chicago Bulls with a score of 129-113 on Wednesday night, marking their fourth consecutive victory.
The Bulls struggled with defense and shooting, making only 12 of 35 three-point attempts during the game.
Zach Lavine scored 31 points for the Bulls.
Indiana jumped out to a commanding 36-18 lead in the second quarter and never looked back, extending their lead to as much as 34 points.
Post-Match Reflections: The loss was significant for the Bulls, who had previously won two out of their last three games.
The Indiana Pacers continued their red-hot streak on Wednesday, defeating the Chicago Bulls 129-113 at Gainbridge Fieldhouse.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pascal Siakam led the Pacers with 26 points, while Zach Lavine scored 31 points for the Bulls.
Thomas Bryant added a season-high 22 points and 8 rebounds.
Tyrese Haliburton had 16 points and 13 assists in the Indiana Pacers’ 129-113 victory over the Chicago Bulls on Wednesday night.
Others: The letdown came on quickly for the Chicago Bulls after two emotional wins at home this week.
The Bulls couldn’t keep the ball in their hands — or out of their own net — as they dropped a 129-113 loss to the Indiana Pacers.
